usefulItems: vegetable peeler, vegetable peeler, sealable storage jar, tart tin (25 cm), plastic wrap, silicone bread mat, rolling pin, pastry brush, pastry cutter, refrigerator, oven
title: Crostata di marmalata (Italian jam tart)

ingredients.content: 500 g fresh mixed berries (e.g raspberries, blackberries, blueberries) (see Tips)
1 vanilla bean, split lengthways, seeds scraped
150 g butter, chilled, cut into pieces, plus extra for greasing
1 lemon, zest only, no white pith
300 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
30 g full cream milk, for brushing
30 g shredded coconut, toasted, for garnishing (optional)

preparations.content: Using a vegetable peeler, remove lemon zest and set aside. Remove white pith from lemon flesh and set flesh aside separate to the zest.
Place lemon zest into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then grate <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mixed berries, reserved lemon flesh, Rapadura sugar and split vanilla bean and seeds and cook <b>25 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Cook for a further <b>10-15 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>, until setting point is reached (see tips), placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.
Allow jam to cool in mixing bowl, remove vanilla pod, then pour into a sealable storage jar and store in refrigerator until needed. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a tart tin (25 cm) and set aside.

Place lemon zest into mixing bowl and grate <b>20 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then repeat grating <b>20 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add plain flour, egg yolks, caster sugar, salt and 150 g butter and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>, then knead <b>20 sec/<b>. Wrap pastry in plastic wrap and place in refrigerator for 30 minutes.

Roll out ⅔ of the pastry onto a silicone bread mat or floured work surface. Line prepared tart tin with rolled out pastry, then place pastry case into refrigerator to chill for 30 minutes. Wrap remaining ⅓ of the pastry in plastic wrap and place back into refrigerator to rest.
Remove tart tin from refrigerator and spoon mixed berry jam into pastry case. Roll out remaining ⅓ pastry, then using a pastry cutter, cut into strips (1 cm wide).
Place pastry strips in a criss-cross pattern over the top of the tart case, spacing each strip 4 cm apart. Brush pastry with milk and bake for 25-30 minutes (180°C) or until pastry is golden.
Allow tart to cool before sprinkling with toasted coconut (optional) and serving.

hintsAndTricks: You can use any berries in this recipe except strawberries. Due to their high water content, strawberries are not recommended as this will affect the setting and consistency of your jam.
Try using any jam of choice to fill this tart (e.g. apricot, citrus marmalade, rhubarb)
<b>Setting point test:<b> place a saucer into the freezer until chilled. Place 1 tsp jam onto chilled saucer. If set, jam will quickly form a gel consistency.
